page.title: 05MANUFACTURING
page.content: One of the largest factories in the block is John Steventon & Sons Ltd., owned by Ideal Standard, an American company. The Royal Venten Works occupies a 14 acre site alongside the Trent and Mersey Canal but the company uses road transport exclusively. The works manufacture bathroom furniture, such as hand basins, pedestals, toilets, urinals, cisterns and bidets in a variety of designs and colours. The baths are made at Hull. The main raw materials are sand from Chelford, after grinding at Stoke, ball clay from Devon, China clay from Cornwall and Nepheline imported through Runcorn from Norway. Breakages are recycled in the industrial process. There are 400 employees, all but 30 office workers manufacturing, packaging or in the warehouse. As the work is strenuous most employees are men.
